Format_Notes: Format: UUID or YYYYMMDD-QC-SEQUENTIAL. Example: '20251202-QC-001'.
Identifies which WO this quality entry relates to.

Suggested_Format: Foreign key to JOB table (if tracking quality by line item)
Format_Notes: Used if WO has multiple jobs and tracking quality per job. Optional if aggregating entire WO.
Ensures data isolation.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2025-12-02.

Suggested_Format: Which shift the units were produced
Format_Notes: Allowed values: SHIFT_1ST, SHIFT_2ND, SAT_OT, SUN_OT, OTHER.
Text. Examples: 'FINAL_INSPECTION', 'INCOMING_MATERIAL', 'IN_PROCESS_QC_SEWING', 'POST_ASSEMBLY'. Identifies where defects were caught.

Suggested_Format: Total units inspected in this quality check
Format_Notes: Positive integer. Examples: 100, 500. Used for PPM/DPMO/FPY/RTY calculations.

Suggested_Format: Units that passed quality (no defects, no rework needed)
Format_Notes: Non-negative integer, <= units_inspected. Used for FPY/RTY calculations (KPI #6, #7).

Suggested_Format: Units with defects found during inspection
Format_Notes: Non-negative integer, <= units_inspected. Examples: 5, 10. Used for PPM/DPMO calculations (KPI #4, #5).

Suggested_Format: Units sent to previous operation for rework (not allowed to continue)
Format_Notes: Non-negative integer. REQUIRED if tracking rework separately from repair. These units count as FAIL for FPY but may PASS for RTY if completed successfully after rework.

Suggested_Format: Units repaired in current operation before moving forward
Format_Notes: Non-negative integer. REQUIRED if tracking repair separately from rework. These units count as FAIL for FPY but may PASS for RTY if repair successful.
Text, semicolon-separated. Examples: 'Stitching:3; Color_Mismatch:1; Sizing:2'. Allows detailed defect analysis. Can be free-form or reference DEFECT_CATEGORY table.

Suggested_Format: Total number of individual defects found (for DPMO calculation)
Format_Notes: Positive integer. Examples: 15 (if 5 units have 3 defects each). If 1 defect per unit, equals units_defective. Used for DPMO = (total_defects / (units_inspected * opportunities_per_unit)) * 1,000,000.

Suggested_Format: User ID or Employee ID of QC inspector who performed check
Format_Notes: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE/USER table. Audit trail for quality decisions.

Suggested_Format: User ID who recorded this quality entry
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. May differ from qc_inspector if data entry is separate.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
Allowed values: VISUAL, MEASUREMENT, FUNCTIONAL_TEST, SAMPLE_CHECK, 100_PERCENT_INSPECTION, OTHER. Indicates inspection rigor.
If sample inspection, what % of production was inspected?
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal 0-100. Examples: 5.0 (5%), 10.0 (10%), 100.0 (100%). Used with inspection_method = SAMPLE_CHECK to calculate confidence.

Format_Notes: Free text up to 500 chars. Examples: 'Defects appear to be supplier material issue', 'Operator training needed for seam strength', 'Equipment calibration required'.
Foreign key to USER table. Optional two-person verification.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).

Suggested_Format: System-generated unique ID for individual defect record
Format_Notes: Format: UUID or QUALITY_ENTRY-DEFECT-SEQ. Example: '20251202-QC-001-DEFECT-001'.
Links defect to its parent quality check.
Allowed values: STITCHING, COLOR_MISMATCH, SIZING, MATERIAL_DEFECT, ASSEMBLY, FINISHING, PACKAGING, OTHER. Supervisors select from dropdown.
Free text up to 300 chars. Examples: 'Crooked seam on left shoulder', 'Color faded after 5 washes', 'Size label missing'.

Suggested_Format: Specific unit/piece identifier (if tracking individual units)
Format_Notes: Text. Examples: 'UNIT-001', 'PIECE-123'. Allows traceability to specific item.

Suggested_Format: Does this defect require rework (return to previous operation)?
Format_Notes: TRUE = rework, FALSE = repair in current operation or scrap.

Suggested_Format: Can this defect be repaired in current operation?
Format_Notes: TRUE = repairable here, FALSE = must rework or scrap.
TRUE = scrap, FALSE = recovered via rework/repair. Used for scrap rate analysis.
Allowed values: OPERATOR_ERROR, MATERIAL_ISSUE, EQUIPMENT_ISSUE, PROCESS_ISSUE, DESIGN_ISSUE, UNKNOWN. Useful for improvement planning.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
Text, alphanumeric. Must match part_number in JOB/WORK_ORDER tables. Examples: 'BOOT-ABC123', 'SOCK-XYZ789'.

Suggested_Format: Number of defect opportunities per unit (for DPMO calculation)
Format_Notes: Positive integer. Examples: 1 (simple), 47 (complex garment), 10 (average). Used in DPMO formula: (total_defects / (units_inspected * opportunities_per_unit)) * 1,000,000.

Suggested_Format: Description of part and breakdown of opportunities
Format_Notes: Free text. Example: 'Western Boot - opportunities: toe box seam (2), heel seam (2), sole adhesion (1), stitching integrity (5), fit/sizing (10), color match (2), material defects (25)'.

Suggested_Format: User ID (Quality/Engineering) who last updated opportunities
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Audit trail.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). Quality/Engineering updates as specs change.

Suggested_Format: Notes about this part's quality expectations
Format_Notes: Free text. Example: 'Critical check points: seams must be straight, colors must match standard, sizing per chart'.
